section.name: DocCommands
section.p: Using these buttons you can save and export the current document. You can also quickly undo/redo actions.

section.name: View
section.p: With the view menu you can change the preview mesh, shading style, and IBL environment.
Supporting shading styles are Rough-Metal, Rough-Specular, Glossy-Metal, and Glossy-Specular.
On higher performing machines you can also turn on displacement mapping to view your relief maps.

section.name: Expand
section.p: Expands the [b]Node Canvas[/b] or [b]Viewport[/b] view to fill the whole window.

section.name: Viewport
section.p: Use the [b]W S A D[/b] keys to move the camera along the view plane. Use the [b]E[/b] and [b]C[/b] keys to move it up and down.
Hold the [b]RIGHT MOUSE[/b] button down to orbit the camera.
Hold the [b]CTRL + RIGHT MOUSE[/b] button down to turn the camera in place.
Hold the [b]MIDDLE MOUSE[/b] button down to dolly the camera forward and backward.

section.name: NodePalette
section.p: You can drag nodes from the [b]Node Palette[/b] onto the [b]Node Canvas[/b] to create new nodes.

section.name: AuxTabs
section.p: The auxilary tabs provide extra information about the program and your selections.
They're used to view message logs, inspect the properties of multiple objects, and view permutations.

section.name: Properties
section.p: The properties panel is where you'll be doing most of your editing of the settings of the nodes in the [b]Node Canvas[/b].
In the same set of tabs is the [b]History[/b] tab that contains the undo/redo history of the current document.

section.name: Documents
section.p: Opened documents can be closed and switched through the popup menu here.
The number indicates how many documents are opened.

section.name: Routes
section.p: You can create manual routes for nodes by holding down [b]ALT[/b] and clicking on the connector line.
These route handles can be dragged around freely to organize your graph.
They can be removed by double clicking on the handle.

section.name: Selected
section.p: Selected nodes and connectors will be bright yellow.
You can hold down [b]CTRL[/b] and click on multiple nodes/connectors to select many of them.
You can also hold down [b]SHIFT[/b] then click and drag a box selector to select multiple nodes.
Selections can be cut, copied, moved, or deleted.

section.name: Canvas
section.p: The [b]Node Canvas[/b] can be panned by clicking and dragging.
You can zoom in and out with the [b]MIDDLE MOUSE WHEEL[/b] as well as the [b]+[/b] and [b]-[/b] keys.
Press the [b]HOME[/b] key to return the center of the graph.
The [b]ARROW[/b] keys will pan the canvas, hold shift to pan more quickly.
